bibl.title: Chung Him and Seid Yam v. Henry M. White. Mandate
bibl.note: Our transcription is based on a digital image of the microfilmed original.

org.orgName: The District Court of the United States, Western District of Washington, Northern Division

div1.p: United States Circuit Court of Appeals for the Ninth Circuit
HENRY M. WHITE, as Commissioner of Immigration at the Port of Seattle, Washington, etc.,
Filed in the United States District Court

p.del: Leet the written mandate be entered this 16 day of October 1922

div1.p: The President of the United States of America, To the Honorable the Judges of the District Court of the United States for the Western District of Washington, Northern Division,

Whereas, lately in the District court of the United States for the Western District of Washington, Northern Division, before you, or some of you, in a cause between entitled In the Matter of the Application of CHUNG HIM and SEID YAM for a Writ of Habeas Corpus, No. 5630, a Decree was duly filed on the 6th day of December, A.D. 1920, in the words and figures following to wit:

"Ordered, Adjudged and Decreed that the petitioners, Chung Him and Seid Yam, be and they are hereby released and discharged, and the said respondent, Henry M. White, and all persons acting under his authority be, and they are hereby ordered to release the said petitioners and each of them.

"And it is further ordered that in view of the announcement in open court by the United States Attorney of his intention forthwith to appeal to the United States Circuit Court of Appeals for the Ninth Circuit, that the said petitioners shall be released from custody pending the determination of said appeal only upon the furnishing by each petitioner of bond in the sum of One Thousand Dollars ($1,000.00), as is more fully provided in that certain order of this date concurrently signed, filed and entered herein.
"Done in open court this 6th day of December, 1920.

Which said Decree is of record and fully set out in said cause in the office of the Clerk of the said District Court, to which record reference is hereby made and the same is hereby expressly made a part hereof, and

as by the inspection of the Transcript of the Record of the said District Court, which was brought into the United States Circuit Court of Appeals for the Ninth Circuit by virtue of an appeal prosecuted by Henry M. White, as Commissioner of Immigration at the Port of Seattle, Washington, for the United States Government, as appellant, against Chung Him and Seid Yam, as appellees, agreeably to the Act of Congress in such cases made and provided, fully and at large appears:

And Whereas, on the 10th day of May in the year of our Lord One Thousand Nine Hundred and Twenty-one the said cause came on to be heard before the said Circuit Court of Appeals, on the said Transcript of the Record and was duly argued and submitted:
On Consideration Whereof, It is now here ordered, adjudged, and decreed by this Court, that the judgment of the said District Court in this cause be, and hereby is, reversed.

That such further proceedings be had in the said cause in accordance with the opinion and decree of this Court and as according to right and justice and the laws of the United States ought to be had, the said decree of the said District Court notwithstanding.

Witness, the Honorable Edward Douglas White WILLIAM HOWARD TAFT, Chief Justice of the United States, the 7th day of September, in the year of our Lord One Thousand, Nine Hundred and Twenty-two and of the Independence of the United States of America the One Hundred and Forty-seventh.
Clerk of the United States Circuit Court of Appeals for the Ninth Circuit
